summary: A letter from attorney Donnie Murrell to the Palm Beach Police Department stating that he represents Juan and Maria Alessi and that they are unwilling to be interviewed by detectives. This document indicates the Alessi's legal representation and non-cooperation with the investigation in November 2005.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.role: Attorney representing Juan and Maria Alessi
persons.context: Author of the letter, identifies himself as representing Mr. and Mrs. Alessi and informs the police they will not be interviewed.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Mentioned as a client of Donnie Murrell who is unwilling to be interviewed by the Palm Beach Police Department.

persons.name: Maria Alessi
persons.context: Mentioned as a client of Donnie Murrell who is unwilling to be interviewed by the Palm Beach Police Department.

connections.description: Murrell states he represents Juan Alessi and is communicating on his behalf to law enforcement.
Murrell states he represents Maria Alessi and is communicating on her behalf to law enforcement.
Referred to together as 'Mr. and Mrs. Alessi', indicating a spousal or familial relationship.

events.title: Attorney letter of non-cooperation
events.description: Attorney Donnie Murrell sends a letter to the Palm Beach Police Department stating his clients, Juan and Maria Alessi, will not submit to interviews.

locations: 345 South County Road, Palm Beach, Fl. 33480 (Palm Beach Police Dept.)
keyFacts: Attorney Donnie Murrell represented Juan and Maria Alessi in November 2005.
Juan and Maria Alessi refused to be interviewed by the Palm Beach Police Department regarding the Epstein investigation.
The document is a formal legal communication asserting the Alessi's right to remain silent and not cooperate with law enforcement.
The document is marked as subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating it was part of sealed or restricted case materials.
